results.name: a(n) = sigma_n(n) - n^n.
comment: a(n) is the sum of n-th powers of proper divisors of n.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..400
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Proper divisors
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
mathematica: nmax = 25; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[Sum[(k x)^(2 k)/(1 - (k x)^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]]
program: (MAGMA) [DivisorSigma(n, n) - n^n: n in [1..30]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 02 2018
(PARI) a(n) = sigma(n, n) - n^n; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 02 2018
